intro: Simarouba glauca var. latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf simarouba, is a tropical tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other hardwoods. The plant is characterized by its broad, elliptical leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. Its fruit is a woody capsule that splits open to release smooth, black seeds. The tree is valued for its durable timber and has traditional uses in medicine and dye production.
